quotes.text: If you were to offer a thirsty man all wisdom, you would not please him more than if you gave him a drink.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: A soul that is kind and intends justice discovers more than any sophist.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Not to be born is, past all prizing, best.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Fortune cannot aid those who do nothing.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: There is no sense in crying over spilt milk. Why bewail what is done and cannot be recalled?
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Kindness is ever the begetter of kindness.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Foolishness is indeed the sister of wickedness.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: If you have done terrible things, you must endure terrible things; for thus the sacred light of injustice shines bright.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: There is no greater evil for men than the constraint of fortune.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Evil counsel travels fast.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Not all things are to be discovered; many are better concealed.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: A word does not frighten the man who, in acting, feels no fear.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: But whoever gives birth to useless children, what would you say of him except that he has bred sorrows for himself, and furnishes laughter for his enemies.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Whoever grows angry amid troubles applies a drug worse than the disease and is a physician unskilled about misfortunes.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: A wise doctor does not mutter incantations over a sore that needs the knife.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Whoever neglects the arts when he is young has lost the past and is dead to the future.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Deem no man happy until he passes the end of his life without suffering grief.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: It was my care to make my life illustrious not by words more than by deeds.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: No man loves the bearer of bad tidings.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: There is a point at which even justice does injury.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Men of ill judgment ignore the good that lies within their hands, till they have lost it.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Hush! Check those words. Do not cure ill with ill and make your pain still heavier than it is.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Gratitude to gratitude always gives birth.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Despair often breeds disease.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: In a just cause the weak will beat the strong.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Better not to exist than live basely.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Not even old age knows how to love death.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: To live without evil belongs only to the gods.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Evil gains work their punishment.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Whoever thinks his friend more important than his country, I rate him nowhere.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: No lie ever reaches old age.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: No one longs to live more than someone growing old.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: No speech can stain what is noble by nature.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Do not grieve yourself too much for those you hate, nor yet forget them utterly.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: For those whose wit becomes the mother of villainy, those it educates to be evil in all things.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: To give birth is a fearsome thing; there is no hating the child one has borne even when injured by it.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: No treaty is ever an impediment to a cheat.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: It is a base thing for a man among the people not to obey those in command. Never in a state can the laws be well administered when fear does not stand firm.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: For shameful deeds are taught by shameful deeds.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: No one who errs unwillingly is evil.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: There is some pleasure even in words, when they bring forgetfulness of present miseries.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: There is nothing more hateful than bad advice.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: I see the state of all of us who live, nothing more than phantoms or a weightless shadow.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: It is the merit of a general to impart good news, and to conceal the truth.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: What house, bloated with luxury, ever became prosperous without a woman's excellence?
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: When trouble ends even troubles please.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Every man can see things far off but is blind to what is near.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Reverence does not die with mortals, nor does it perish whether they live or die.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: The gods plant reason in mankind, of all good gifts the highest.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: He who throws away a friend is as bad as he who throws away his life.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: There are some who praise a man free from disease; to me no man who is poor seems free from disease but to be constantly sick.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Don't you know that silence supports the accuser's charge?
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: If one begins all deeds well, it is likely that they will end well too.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Whoever lives among many evils just as I, how can dying not be a source of gain?
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Whoever understands how to do a kindness when he fares well would be a friend better than any possession.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: It's impossible to speak what it is not noble to do.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: There is an ancient saying among men that you cannot thoroughly understand the life of mortals before the man has died, then only can you call it good or bad.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Whoever gets up and comes to grips with Love like a boxer is a fool.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Those whose life is long still strive for gain, and for all mortals all things take second place to money.
quotes.author: Sophocles
